channel.title: Deltascape Files!
channel.description: I downloaded DeltaScape, and the files won't open, it says "Use internet to open". Can someone help me with this problem?

item.title: Deltascape Files!
item.dc:creator: @3_Days_Grace 3 Days Grace
item.description:
@3_Days_Grace wrote:

Maybe this will work.
Right-Click the compile > edit> then delete everything there and replace it with this : @echo off @TITLE (YourServer Name <---) if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

[size=24pt]You can edit this : (YourServer Name <—) to anything you want, it is usually the name of your server[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Files!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

[quote=“smitherdrago, post:4, topic:341745”]change the
“C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0/bin/javac.exe” -d
this number^^ the jdk number[/quote]

I will explain this in more detail.

Go into “My Computer”, click on hard drivce C. Then click on Program Files. After that scroll down to java, and the double click on it. Find your JDK verion (ex. jdk1.6.0). Then go to your compiler right click, and edit it. Mak sure those numbers in your java file are the same ones that are in yor compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Files!
item.dc:creator: @k1_blade k1 blade
item.description:
@k1_blade wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:2, topic:341745”]lol haha! Ok go to the files. Right click, and click on “open with”. Then choose notepad or whatever text editor you have.

Or just simply right click on the files and click “edit”.[/quote]

Yeah I found it already. But my compiler isn’t working. Says “Np path specified”

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape Files!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

lol haha! Ok go to the files. Right click, and click on “open with”. Then choose notepad or whatever text editor you have.

Or just simply right click on the files and click “edit”.

Read full topic
